intro: Amitostigma parceflorum, commonly known as the slender amitostigma, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant features delicate, trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers with five petals. It typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
